meanings.definition: A type of footwear, typically made of soft material and worn indoors.
meanings.sent1: She slipped on her babiches before padding around the house.
meanings.sent2: I love wearing my cozy babiches on lazy Sundays.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to steal my babiches to use as a bed!
meanings.sent4: Her babiches whispered against the floor as she tiptoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the fireplace enveloped her feet like a pair of babiches.

meanings.definition: To move quickly and lightly, as if wearing babiches.
meanings.sent1: The children babiched across the playground, giggling all the way.
meanings.sent2: I need to babich through the crowd to catch my bus on time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel babiched up the tree with an acorn in its mouth.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to babich by as they danced under the stars.
meanings.sent5: Her heart began to babich with excitement as she approached the finish line.

meanings.definition: Describing something as soft and comfortable, like babiches.
meanings.sent1: The blanket was so babiches, I could fall asleep instantly.
meanings.sent2: She sank into the babiches armchair, feeling all her worries melt away.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's fur was as babiches as a cloud in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The music wrapped around her like a babiches embrace.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh cookies filled the room with a babiches sweetness.
